topic.title: Localization for the pdf-css-html5 Transformation Type

body.p: This information applies to the DITA Map PDF - based on HTML5 & CSS transformation type.

In this transformation, the intermediate merged DITA map is transformed to HTML5 using the DITA-OT built-in support, so the customization of the internationalization (the labels for chapters, parts, figures, tables, notes, etc..) can be realized respecting the DITA-OT recommendations: .

You should perform this customization on a DITA-OT deployed outside the oXygen installation, so you will not loose the customization when you upgrade. Ask our support team for the Oxygen Publishing Engine package.

It is worth mentioning that you can also use the internationalization technique described in the , but you will first need to hide the structure generated by the XSL HTML5 transformation (like the caption elements for tables, or span elements for notes) then replace the labels with your own, defined in CSS.
To identify the selectors for the elements you need to hide, see .
